title: Is ""11 U.S.C. , (362) (C) (3) (A) """ exception to automatic stay if debtor is a corporation
question: "11 U.S.C. , (362) (C) (3) (A) "" states that :
answers: This section, by its own terms, applies only to individuals, not to corporations.

Subsection 362(c)(3)(A) specifically refers to cases filed by or against a debtor who is an individual. A corporation is not an "individual" so no, this particular subsection does not apply to a debtor that is a corporation. That does not mean that there isn't a similar provision that does apply to corporations, it simply means that the quoted provision does not.
In my opinion, Section 362(c)(3) or (4) do not apply to corporations at all.
Yes it would but your counsel can file a motion to extend the provisions of the automatic stay.
